qas.question: How is sunlight converted into electricity?

answers.text: either directly using photovoltaics (PV), or indirectly using concentrated solar power (CSP)

qas.question: What does a concentrated solar power system use?

answers.text: lenses or mirrors and tracking systems

qas.question: What is the purpose of a concentrated solar power system?

answers.text: focus a large area of sunlight into a small beam

qas.question: What method does the photovoltaics system use to turn light into electricity?

context: Solar power is the <a0_0>conversion of sunlight into electricity<a0_0/>, <a1_0>either directly using photovoltaics (PV), or indirectly using concentrated solar power (CSP)<a1_0/>. CSP systems use <a2_0>lenses or mirrors and tracking systems<a2_0/> to <a3_0>focus a large area of sunlight into a small beam<a3_0/>. PV converts light into electric current using the <a4_0>photoelectric effect<a4_0/>.
